persName.note: Although the 醉翁亭記 is one of Ouyang Xiu's most popular texts, later writers tend to refer to him by his later hao, 六一(先生).

person.note: Ouyang Xiu [1384] His ancestors were Bohai jun Ouyang and then Changsha jun Ouyang. See documentation for ancestor, Jian [12193]. The fourth generation descendant of the Tang minister Ouyang Xun [3685], Ouyang Cong [3688], was once prefect of Jizhou, from this time on, the descendants of this branch of the lineage lived in Jizhou, Luling xian (actually, territory later to become Yongfeng county). Cong's 8th generation descendant, Wan [12203], moved to Anfu county and established another branch of the lineage (Zai's [1385] branch [see below]). Xiu's great grandfather, Bin [3687], served in the administration of the Southern Tang as did his grandfather, Yan [4184]. Han Qi [630] copies the genealogy down through Bin directly from the Xin Tang Shu. It was during this period that the Ouyang became a great lineage (dazu) of Luling. Xiu's father received the jinshi in 1000 in the same year as his uncle, Ye [3689]. Ouyang(1) Xiu was buried in Zhengzhou, Xingzheng county and this became the address of this branch of the family (e.g. Fa [7308] was also buried in Xinzheng). Zai's [1385] lineage nephew, Fa's [7308] and Fei's [7060] father, Fengshi's [1382] great grandfather. Xu Yan's [7116], Xue Kui's [803] and Yang Daya's [2029] son-in-law. His wife was both Xue Zhongru's [7108] cousin and sister by adoption. He was the grandfather-in-law of Su Song's [8116] son, Jing [3754], Wang Cun's [1897] son, Wei [3991], and Yuan Jiang's [2112] son, Qibi [4137], and of Su Che's [1493] nephew, Dai [3771]. He was the maternal great grandfather and grandfather-in-law of Su Shide [1504]. All of Xiu's granddaughters married into shizu; see Fei's [7060] entry for other affinal connections. A descendant (probably grandson) Ouyang Zhong [3684] was the father-in-law of Fan E's [568] grandson Fan Rong [3281]. Xingshi [1383] has the same generational name as Xiu's great grandsons. Xiu was Zhang Ju's [209] Yijing teacher. Han Qi, WJ, 50.1a-11b; XCB, 151.18a, 156.3a, 157.3a, 413.11a- 17b; XTS, 74b.1a-1b. Ouyang Xiu, WJ, 62.6b-7a (wife #1, born Xu, who died in 1033 at age 17), 7a-7b (wife #2, born Yang, who died in 1034 at age 18); SHY:ZG, 64.51a-51b; SHY:SH, 49.14b; Su Zhe, WJ, 25.5a-7a (wife #3, born Xue, who died in 1089 at age 73); 'houji,' 23.1a-9b. CBD, 5, 3748-3754.

desc.label: 工詩 以深遠古淡為意 歐陽修與為詩友 自以為不及 以蔭為桐城、河南、河陽主簿
李秀才東園亭記(歐陽文忠公集63/7下)
濰州人 有道術 與歐陽修善 一日求去甚力 修留之不可
坐謫流落 善真行書 歐陽修憐其貧 每與人作碑誌 必先約令經書之
神宗初 累遷殿中侍御史 以誣劾歐陽修貶官 旋為淮東轉運副使 歲惡民流
歐陽修奏醫人夏日華試國子四門助教不理選限制(臨川集55/12)
質疑問難 諸生屈服 歐陽修薦於朝 仁宗召見講易 善之
字希參 濮州人 歐陽修薦其知邊事 可任將帥 累官涇原鄜延秦鳳副總管
因築室瀰水之濱 五十年不踐城市 歐陽修言於朝 賜號沖退居士 年八十餘卒
余靖、尹洙論救 均貶斥 歐陽修移書責若訥 若訥忿 奏貶修夷陵令
文彥博薦諸朝 賜五品服 劉敞與歐陽修乞追還詔書 昌期懼 不敢受賜

desc.desc: Praised or admired bySupportive political association

desc.label: 喜讀漢書 以文學見重 歐陽修、王安石咸稱之 熙寧四年卒 年四十九
官秭歸令 疏鑿新灘以便舟楫 歐陽修銘其功於石 終永州通判
永嘉人 曄父 以文行為歐陽修所器重
嘗論洪範九璹聖人之法 非有龜書出洛之事也 歐陽修亟稱之
諡元獻 殊平居好賢 范仲淹、孔道輔、歐陽修等皆出其門 及為相 仲淹與韓琦、富弼皆進用
永康人 從歐陽修學古文辭 修稱其文日進 如水湧山出
錢塘人 從歐陽修遊三十餘年 長於詩 為一聰明才智有學問者
梁適不當除翰林學士 范仲淹宜在左右 尹洙、余靖、歐陽修皆以朋黨斥逐 此小人惡直醜正者也 既而與靖等相失
以進士起家 慶曆五年 歐陽修以言事切直為權貴人所怒 因其孤甥女有獄 誣以姦利事
第進士 累官天章閣待制 歐陽修出政府 思恭盡力救解 出知江寧府、鄧州
改右正言 知制誥 時杜衍、韓琦、范仲淹、富弼相繼罷去 修上疏極諫 出知滁州
